^Aging SuccessfullyH NAEB is helping its member stations
to render an important adult education service to their
listeners* We hope the NAEB will increase the number of
such programs* We do believe that the NAEB might well
call upon specialists in adult education for assistance
in selecting future adult education programs. We suggest
the Adult Education Association of the United States of
America, the adult education department of the National
Educational Association, and the office of the Specialist
for General Adult and Post-High School Education, United
States Office of Education*
II* NETWORK GENERAL SERVICES
Our discussion of general NAEB services includes both
radio and television although only a handful of university
stations now are active in television. We are hopeful that
Ohio State University eventually will be concerned with both
broadcast media.
Determining Audience Needs
Returning to the adult education peoole mentioned
earlier, perhaps these specialists also might be able to
assist NAEB university station personnel to become better
acquainted with some of the techniques for determing the
adult education interests and needs in the geographical
areas served by their stations. For example, one way to
learn adult education needs is to study census data in terms
of identifying needs of various groups in the area covered
by a radio station. BAging Successfully11 illustrates an
appeal to a particular group...the older folks.
